parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: An events domain that contains protocol violations and deviations during the course of the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49585, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the deviation category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Protocol Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DVCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the protocol deviation?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the deviation event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DVCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DVSCAT can only be used if there is an DVCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DVCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Protocol Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DVSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the protocol deviation?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Enter Yes if a protocol deviation occurred and No if none occurred. Ensure that any adverse event which triggers a protocol deviation (e.g., concomitant medication use, newly discovered medical history) is noted in the respective CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether there were any protocol deviations.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Protocol Deviation
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DVYN

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record protocol deviations identified and/or select the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.
fields.definition: The sponsor-defined standardized text for the name of the protocol deviation.
fields.implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a codelist of responses, then DVDECOD should be used to store the codelist response. Sponsors must use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF and, in some cases, both may be used. For example, if the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of codelist items, then DVTERM should be used to store the detailed descriptive text.
fields.label: Protocol Deviation Coded Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DVDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the protocol deviation.
fields.implementationNotes: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a free-text field, then DVTERM should be used to store the free-text response. Sponsors may use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF, but a value in DVTERM is required in the SDTM-based datasets.
fields.label: Protocol Deviation Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DVTERM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation term?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date that the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation, not the date it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The start date of deviation, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This may be derived if not collected on a CRF.
fields.label: Deviation Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation, not the time it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The start time of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: Deviation Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation start time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the date the protocol deviation stopped, not the date it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The end date of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.label: Deviation End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the end time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss). This should be the time the protocol deviation stopped, not the time it was discovered or reported.
fields.definition: The end time of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: Deviation End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DVENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the protocol deviation end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: DV Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: DVSPID

label: Protocol Deviations
name: DV
